title: Would anyone but the makers of blue and pink tat lament the end of the gender-reveal party?
text:
The slurry of Hallowe’en tat currently infesting the supermarket shelves is testament to two irrepressible human traits. The first is our endearing tendency to seize any opportunity, however tenuous, for a celebration. The second is our compulsion to monetise the hell out of these joyful moments.

Once the djinn of commerce is out of the bottle, there is no persuading it back, however inconvenient the consequences. No one knows this better than Jenna Myers Karvunidis, a Los Angeles-based blogger with a passion for parties. In 2008, pregnant with her first child, she came up with a plan to celebrate her 20‑week scan.

Asking the midwife not to tell her the baby’s sex, but to seal the result in an...
description: The slurry of Hallowe’en tat currently infesting the supermarket shelves is testament to two irrepressible human traits.
